text:
What’s wrong? I’m trying to use <https://github.com/StatisticalRethinkingJulia/StatisticsWithJuliaPlutoNotebooks.jl>
```(base) arihuttunen@The-Best-MacBook-Pro StatisticsWithJuliaPlutoNotebooks.jl % julia
               _
   _       _ _(_)_     |  Documentation: <https://docs.julialang.org>
  (_)     | (_) (_)    |
   _ _   _| |_  __ _   |  Type "?" for help, "]?" for Pkg help.
  | | | | | | |/ _` |  |
  | | |_| | | | (_| |  |  Version 1.5.3 (2020-11-09)
 _/ |\__'_|_|_|\__'_|  |  Official <https://julialang.org/> release
|__/                   |

julia> cd("/Volumes/MyFiles/ProjectsExternal/StatisticsWithJuliaPlutoNotebooks.jl")

(@v1.5) pkg> activate .
 Activating environment at `/Volumes/MyFiles/ProjectsExternal/StatisticsWithJuliaPlutoNotebooks.jl/Project.toml`

(StatisticsWithJuliaPlutoNotebooks) pkg> instantiate

text: Probably a Julia 1.6 manifest used on Julia 1.5 or something like that.

elements.text: Probably a Julia 1.6 manifest used on Julia 1.5 or something like that.

text: Thanks, I just deleted the manifest (but leaving project.toml), and at least it goes forward.
